section_id: ## 12.3. The Complete Lyapunov Drift Under Cloning

hints.label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
hints.title: Complete Drift Inequality for the Cloning Operator
hints.content:
8145: :label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
8146: 
8147: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), the cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ (see {prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator-formal`) induces the following drift on the synergistic Lyapunov function:
8148: 
8149: $$
8150: V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + c_V V_{\text{Var}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)
8151: $$
8152: 
8153: **Individual Component Drifts:**
8154: 
8155: $$
8156: \begin{aligned}
8157: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] &\leq C_W \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8158: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] &\leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x \quad &\text{(strong contraction)} \\
8159: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] &\leq C_v \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8160: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] &\leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b \quad &\text{(strong contraction)}
8161: \end{aligned}
8162: $$
8163: 
8164: **Combined Drift:**
8165: 
8166: $$
8167: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_v + C_x) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)
8168: $$
8169: 
8170: **Critical Property - Partial Contraction:**
8171: 
8172: When $V_{\text{Var},x}$ and $W_b$ are sufficiently large relative to the expansion terms, the drift becomes negative:
8173: 
8174: $$
8175: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] < 0 \quad \text{when } c_V V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B W_b > \frac{C_W + c_V(C_v + C_x) + c_B C_b}{\min(\kappa_x, \kappa_b)}
hints.section: ## 12.3. The Complete Lyapunov Drift Under Cloning
hints.raw_directive:
8142: ### 12.3.1. Main Result
8143: 
8144: :::{prf:theorem} Complete Drift Inequality for the Cloning Operator
8145: :label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
8146: 
8147: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), the cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ (see {prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator-formal`) induces the following drift on the synergistic Lyapunov function:
8148: 
8149: $$
8150: V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + c_V V_{\text{Var}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)
8151: $$
8152: 
8153: **Individual Component Drifts:**
8154: 
8155: $$
8156: \begin{aligned}
8157: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] &\leq C_W \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8158: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] &\leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x \quad &\text{(strong contraction)} \\
8159: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] &\leq C_v \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8160: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] &\leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b \quad &\text{(strong contraction)}
8161: \end{aligned}
8162: $$
8163: 
8164: **Combined Drift:**
8165: 
8166: $$
8167: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_v + C_x) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)
8168: $$
8169: 
8170: **Critical Property - Partial Contraction:**
8171: 
8172: When $V_{\text{Var},x}$ and $W_b$ are sufficiently large relative to the expansion terms, the drift becomes negative:
8173: 
8174: $$
8175: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] < 0 \quad \text{when } c_V V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B W_b > \frac{C_W + c_V(C_v + C_x) + c_B C_b}{\min(\kappa_x, \kappa_b)}
8176: $$

hints.label: proof-thm-complete-cloning-drift
hints.content:
8180: :::{prf:proof}
8181: :label: proof-thm-complete-cloning-drift
8182: **Proof.**
8183: 
8184: The total drift is obtained by summing the component drifts with their respective weights:
8185: 
8186: $$
8187: \begin{aligned}
8188: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] + c_V \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] + c_B \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] \\
8189: &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] + c_V (\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}]) + c_B \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b]
8190: \end{aligned}
8191: $$
8192: 
8193: Substituting the individual bounds from Theorems 10.3.1, 10.4.1, 11.3.1, and 12.2.1:
8194: 
8195: $$
8196: \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x + C_v) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)
8197: $$
8198: 
8199: Rearranging:
8200: 
8201: $$
8202: = -c_V \kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} - c_B \kappa_b W_b + (C_W + c_V C_x + c_V C_v + c_B C_b)
8203: $$
8204: 
8205: For the drift to be negative, we need the contraction terms to dominate:
8206: 
8207: $$
8208: c_V \kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B \kappa_b W_b > C_W + c_V C_x + c_V C_v + c_B C_b
8209: $$
8210: 
8211: This holds when the weighted variance and boundary potential are sufficiently large.

hints.label: prop-kinetic-necessity
hints.title: Necessity of the Kinetic Operator
hints.content:
8249: :label: prop-kinetic-necessity
8250: 
8251: The cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) alone cannot guarantee convergence to a quasi-stationary distribution ({prf:ref}`def-qsd`). Specifically:
8252: 
8253: 1. **Velocity variance accumulation:** The bounded expansion $+C_v$ per step can accumulate without bound over infinite time if not countered.
8254: 
8255: 2. **Inter-swarm ({prf:ref}`def-swarm-and-state-space`) divergence:** The bounded expansion $+C_W$ means the two coupled swarms can drift arbitrarily far apart without inter-swarm correction.
8256: 
8257: 3. **No velocity equilibrium:** Cloning has no mechanism to dissipate kinetic energy toward a target distribution - it only redistributes it through collisions.
8258: 
8259: Therefore, the **kinetic operator is essential** to:
8260: - Contract $V_{\text{Var},v}$ via Langevin friction (overcoming $C_v$)

hints.raw_directive:
8246: ### 12.3.3. Why Cloning Alone Cannot Achieve Convergence
8247: 
8248: :::{prf:proposition} Necessity of the Kinetic Operator
8249: :label: prop-kinetic-necessity
8250: 
8251: The cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) alone cannot guarantee convergence to a quasi-stationary distribution ({prf:ref}`def-qsd`). Specifically:
8252: 
8253: 1. **Velocity variance accumulation:** The bounded expansion $+C_v$ per step can accumulate without bound over infinite time if not countered.
8254: 
8255: 2. **Inter-swarm ({prf:ref}`def-swarm-and-state-space`) divergence:** The bounded expansion $+C_W$ means the two coupled swarms can drift arbitrarily far apart without inter-swarm correction.
8256: 
8257: 3. **No velocity equilibrium:** Cloning has no mechanism to dissipate kinetic energy toward a target distribution - it only redistributes it through collisions.
8258: 
8259: Therefore, the **kinetic operator is essential** to:
8260: - Contract $V_{\text{Var},v}$ via Langevin friction (overcoming $C_v$)
8261: - Contract $V_W$ via hypocoercive drift and confining potential (overcoming $C_W$)
